ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned how to more deeply analyze films and consider the historical perspective that the films revolved around which may have influenced the directors.
I learned to watch Polish film more critically
I learned a great deal about communist and post-Communist Polish history, directors, actors, and films.
Good
Deeper understanding of polish culture, art, and history. Also learned more about cinematography.
I learned a lot about polish films :)

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think a strength of the course was that the films were relatively accessible for people who may not understand the historical background of the films. A weakness may have been the streaming platform. I think it would have been better if the films were all scheduled to be watched during the weekend so we could have less pressure to watch a film Tuesday night while we have other classes to focus on at the same time.

Strengths: We watched an excellent assortment of films and I felt that the readings were reasonable yet always interesting.

Weaknesses: Sometimes discussion could be a bit lacking. Likewise, sometimes it felt as though we rushed through certain films while spending too much time on others.
awesome

The films and Professor Illakowicz insights on Poland are amazing. Class is based entirely around discussion of the films. At times this discussion can be extremely dry, but adding other activities during the lesson could counteract that.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I think all the practices essentially worked. The only thing that did not work as well was when Professor screen shared clips of the movie during class because this became very choppy and it was difficult to watch with all the lag.
The course reserves system (in combination with Kanopy) made it very easy to access and view films. I thought the course worked well in a virtual format.
Awesome

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would certainly recommend this course to anyone who has an interest in the communist era. It's a very interesting course and it exposes you to a lot of different film genres based on the same concept.
Yes. Just take this class. This is the sign you are looking for.
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student--you get to learn a lot about Polish film with a very chill and kind professor!
Yes
Yes, I would recommend this course to others because it provided and nice and relaxed environment to talk about really interesting topics regarding polish history and film.
Yes the professor is awesome

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: None.
Live virtual seminar
Awesome
